ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: A heat engine receives 2 kW of heat from at 1200 K and gives out 1200 W as work, and the rest as heat heat transfer to the ambient at 300 K. The second-law efficiency of the heat engine is

The thermodynamic property relation, TdS = dU + pdV is derived from the first law of thermodynamics applied for a control mass system (in the absence of motion and gravitational effects), by making the substitutions Which among the following statement is TRUE?
ENGLISH.OPT1: Since are applicable only for internally reversible processes, the above property relation is valid only for internally reversible processes.
ENGLISH.OPT2: Since for processes with internal irreversibilities, TdS ≠ dU + pdV for processes with internal irreversibilities.
ENGLISH.OPT3: for processes with internal irreversibilities, but still the above property relation is applicable for processes with internal irreversibilities.
ENGLISH.OPT4: are also applicable for processes with internal irreversibilities and therefore the above property relation is valid for processes with internal irreversibilities.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: A 50 kg piston in a cylinder with area of cross-section 0.008 m2 is loaded with a linear spring and the outside atmospheric pressure of 100 kPa as shown in the figure. The spring exerts no force on the piston when it is at the bottom of the cylinder and for the state shown, the pressure is 400 kPa with volume 0.4L. The valve is opened to let some air in, causing the piston to rise 2 cm. Find the new pressure. Assume g = 10 m/s2.
What is the lowest pressure at which water can exist in liquid phase in stable equilibrium?

A heat exchanger with no external heat transfer increases the availability of 3 kg/s of water by 1500 kJ/kg using 10 kg/s air coming in at 1400 K and leaving with 600 kJ/kg less availability, the irreversibility will be

A gas expands from an initial state with P1 = 340 kPa and V1 = 0.0425 m3 to final state where P2 = 136 kPa. If the pressure-volume relationship during the process is pV2 = constant. The work transfer by surrounding to gas is

A fluid contained in a cylinder receives 150 kJ of mechanical energy by means of a paddle wheel together with 50 kJ in the form of heat. At the same time a piston in the cylinder moves in such a way that the pressure remains constant at 200 kPa during the fluid expand from 2 m3 to 5 m3, then the change in enthalpy (in kJ) is

The gas neon has a molecular weight of 20.183 and its critical temperature and pressure are 44.5 K and 2.73 MPa. Evaluate specific volume (in m3/kg) for reduced pressure of 2 and reduced temperature of 1.3, the compressibility factor Z is 0.7.

A constant-pressure piston-cylinder assembly contains 0.5 kg water as saturated vapour at 200 kPa. It is now cooled so that the mixture occupies of its initial volume. The heat transferred to the mixture in this process (in kJ). The thermodynamic states of water and steam are given in the table.

Air in reversible polytropic process (n = 1.5) undergoes change in state from 23°C to 103°C. The change in entropy of air (in J/kgK) is ______.

(Correct to one decimal place)

Helium at 300 kPa, 60°C, enters a nozzle with negligible velocity and expands steadily without heat transfer in quasi-equilibrium manner to 120 kPa. The exit velocity (in m/s) is_________. (Round off to the nearest integer)

A rigid vessel with a partition in it, contains initially 2 kg of dry and saturated steam at 7 bar in one compartment and 1 kg of steam with dryness fraction of 0.8 at 3.5 bar in the other compartment. After the partition is removed, the pressure of the mixture is found to be 5 bar. The dryness fraction of final mixture is _______.

(Correct upto two decimal place)
Properties of steam

(Neglect the volume of liquid phase)

The resistance of the windings in a certain motor is found to be 100Ω at a room temperature of 27°C. When operating at full load under steady conditions the resistance of windings is found to be 120 Ω the windings are made of copper wire, whose resistance at t°C is given by R0 = R0(1 +0.004t), where R0 is the resistance at 0°C and t is in degree celsius. The temperature attained by the coil during full load is ______°C. (Correct upto one decimal place)
A mixture of ideal gases consists of 2 kmol of nitrogen and 3 kmol of carbon dioxide at a pressure of 300 kPa. The partial pressure of nitrogen (in kPa) is _______.
0.44 kg of gas having a volume 0.28 m3 and a pressure of 1.4 bar is compressed to a pressure of 14 bar according to PV1.3 = C. Which one and more of the following statement is CORRECT?
ENGLISH.OPT1: Work transfer to gas is 91.6305 kJ.
ENGLISH.OPT2: Work transfer to surrounding is 91.6305 kJ.
ENGLISH.OPT3: Heat transfer to gas is 22.9076 kJ.
ENGLISH.OPT4: Heat transfer to surrounding is 22.09076 kJ.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: Which of the following properties relation(s) is/are valid only for ideal gas undergoing reversible process?

1 kg of gas expands reversibly according to linear law from 4.2 bar to 1.4 bar. The initial and final volumes are 0.004 m3 and 0.02 m3 respectively. The gas is then cooled at constant pressure and finally compressed isothermally back to its initial state of 4.2 bar and 0.004 m3. The work done per cycle is

Consider a carnot cycle executed in a closed system with 0.6 kg of air. The temperature limits of the cycle are 300 K and 1100 K and the minimum and maximum pressures that occur during the cycle are 20 kPa and 30000 kPa. Assume constant specific heats. The properties of air cp = 1.005 kJ/kgK; R = 0.287 kJ/kgK. The heat addition per cycle is

A refrigerator works on carnot cycle between –8°C and 35°C with a motor-compressor of 750 W. It makes ice cubes out of a tray of 0.25 kg liquid water at 10°C and ice is stored at –5°C. The time required for ice making is _____. Take specific heat of water and ice are 4.2 kJ/kgK and 2.1 kJ/kgK respectively. Latent heat = 330 kJ/kg.

Consider a rigid, well insulated container shown in figure. 1 kg of air (M = 29) initially at 5 bar, 350 K and 3 kg CO2(M = 44), initially at 2 bar, 450 K are confined to opposite sides of the container. The partition is free to move and allows conduction from one gas to another without energy storage in the partition itself. Assuming the air and CO2 as ideal gases and constant specific heats as CV, air = 0.718 kJ/kgK and CV,CO2 = 0.750 kJ/kgK. The final equilibrium pressure is

In an engine cylinder, a gas has volumetric analysis of 13% CO2, 12.5% O2 and 74.5% N2. The temperature at the beginning of expansion is 1050°C and gas mixture expands reversibly through a volume ratio 8 : 1. According to the law PV1.2 = Constant. The value of characteristic gas constant for constituents CO2, O2 and N2 are 0.189 kJ/kgK, 0.260 kJ/kgK and 0.297 kJ/kgK respectively. The work transfer to surrounding is

Hot combustion gases enter the nozzle at 260 kPa, 747°C and 80 m/s and exit at 70 kPa, 500°C and 758 m/s. Assume nozzle to be adiabatic and the surroundings to be at 20°C. The decrease in the exergy of the gases will be (in kJ/kg).
Take, specific heats ratio as 1.3, gas constant as 0.2654 kJ/kgK and specific heat at constant pressure as 1.15 kJ/kgK.

A large vessel contains helium (M = 4, = 1.67) of 20 bar and a temperature of 350°C. This large vessel is connected to a gas turbine through a valve followed by small initially evacuated tank with volume of 1 m3. The valve is opened and the tank is filled with gas (helium) until pressure is 20 bar. The temperature of helium in the tank is then 500°C. Assume that the filling process takes place adiabatically and change in kinetic and potential energies are negligible. The work developed by the gas turbine is _______. (Round off to the nearest integer)

One mole of an ideal gas undergoes two different cyclic processes I and II, as shown in the P-V diagram below. In Cycle I, processes a, b, c and d are isobaric, isothermal, isobaric and isochoric respectively. In cycle II, processes a′, b′, c′ and d′ are isothermal, isochoric, isobaric and isochoric respectively. The total work done during cycle-I is and that during cycle II is The ratio is ______.

A 1500 W electrical heater is used for 1 hour to heat 20 kg of water (CP = 4.2 kJ/kgK) in an insulated bucket, from a temperature of 50°C to 100°C. If the heater temperature is only infinitesimally larger than the water temperature during the process, the change in entropy of heater is ______ J/K. (Round off to the nearest integer)

Consider a gas mixture of molecular weight of 35, initially at 5 bar, 500 K and occupying a volume of 0.2 m3. The gas undergoes an expansion to 0.4 m3 during which the pressure volume relation is PV1.5 = constant. Assume CV = 0.6 + 2.5 × 10–4T, where T is in K and CV is in kJ/kgK. The heat transfer to surroundings is ______ kJ. (Round off to the nearest integer)

Steam (100 kg/s) at 2.5 MPa and 300°C is expands in turbine to 0.05 MPa, at the exit of the turbine, steam is dry saturated. The shaft work during expansion is 30 MW and the turbine casing is maintained at an average temperature of 150°C, where the ambient is at 30°C. The total entropy generation within the turbine is _______ kW/K. (Round off to the nearest integer properties at inlet and exit are given below).

1 kg of air is compressed reversibly and adiabatically from 80 kPa and 60°C to 0.4 MPa and is then expanded at constant pressure to the original volume. The change in entropy for whole path is _______ J/K. (Round off to the nearest integer, specific heat at constant volume CV = 0.7 kJ/kgK)

A heat engine operates between the minimum and maximum temperature of 30°C and 1000°C respectively, with the efficiency of 50% of its carnot efficiency. It drives a reversible heat pump which uses river water at 5°C to heat a block of flats in which temperature is to be maintained at 22°C. Assume that the temperature difference of 11°C exits between the working fluid and the river water, on one hand, and the required room temperature on the other hand. The heat input to the engine per unit heat output from the heat pump is _____. (Correct upto 2 decimal places)

An insulated, vertical piston cylinder device initially contain 10 kg of water, 6 kg of which is in the vapour phase. The mass of piston is such that it maintains a constant pressure of 200 kPa inside the cylinder. Now steam at 0.5 MPa and 360°C is allowed to enter the cylinder from a supply line until all the liquid in the cylinder has vaporized. The mass of steam that has entered is ________ kg.

An insulated 2 m3 rigid tank contains air at 500 kPa and 50°C. A valve connected to the tank is now opened and air is allowed to escape until the pressure inside drop to 100 kPa. The air temperature during this process is maintained constant by an electric resistance heater placed in the tank. The electric work done (in kJ) during this process is _____.
Which of the following statement(s) is/are CORRECT?
ENGLISH.OPT1: Isentropic compression of incompressible fluid is isothermal also.
ENGLISH.OPT2: A cycle comprise of two reversible adiabatic followed by isothermal process will violetes 2nd law of thermodynamics.
ENGLISH.OPT3: A cycle comprise of two reversible adiabatic followed by isothermal process will violets 1st law of thermodynamics.
ENGLISH.OPT4: An irreversible adiabatic process always lead to increase entropy of universe.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT:
One kg of CO2 (M = 44 and = 1.33) at 2 bar and 700 K is mixed adiabatically in rigid tank with one kg of O2 (M = 32 and = 1.4) at the same pressure and temperature by removing the partition in the chamber as shown in the figure, if atmospheric temperature is 300 K.

Which of the statement(s) given below is/are CORRECT?
ENGLISH.OPT1: Final pressure and temperature of mixture is 2 bar and 700 K respectively.
ENGLISH.OPT4: For the same given condition, if both gases are same, then the mixing will be reversible.
